meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a vulture.
meanings.sent1: The vulturine bird soared high in the sky, scanning for prey below.
meanings.sent2: The vulturine features of the scavenger bird made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent3: The vulturine creature had a sharp beak and keen eyes, perfect for hunting.
meanings.sent4: Her vulturine gaze seemed to pierce through any facade, revealing the truth within.
meanings.sent5: The vulturine silhouette against the sunset was both majestic and eerie.

meanings.definition: Acting in a predatory or scavenging manner.
meanings.sent1: The vulturine behavior of the hyena showed its skill in finding food.
meanings.sent2: The vulturine instincts of the hawk guided it to its next meal.
meanings.sent3: The vulturine raccoon cleverly scavenged through the trash for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: His vulturine tactics in negotiations often left his opponents at a disadvantage.
meanings.sent5: The vulturine cat stealthily stalked its prey before pouncing.

meanings.sent1: The vulturine feathers of the bird were essential for its flight.
meanings.sent2: The vulturine diet of the scavenger bird consisted mainly of carrion.
meanings.sent3: The vulturine nest was perched high on a cliff, away from predators.
meanings.sent4: The vulturine population in the area helped keep the ecosystem balanced.
meanings.sent5: The vulturine call echoed through the canyon, signaling the presence of the birds.
